abstract: Deep in the credit crisis, the bond market started on a rally that has refused to slacken, leading to some of the lowest borrowing costs ever seen, which companies are now running to take advantage of, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Deep in the credit crisis, the bond market started on a rally that has refused to slacken, leading to some of the lowest borrowing costs ever seen, which companies are now running to take advantage of, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: Deep in the credit crisis, the bond market started on a rally that has refused to slacken, leading to some of the lowest borrowing costs ever seen, which companies are now running to take advantage of, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: Low Borrowing Costs See Race to Sell Debt
